issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
In my HA setup after failover I am seeing these exceptions in the log.  I do not have exact steps to reproduce but the setup has a few instances running in scaling groups and a load balancer. There had been some isntance churn but until HA failover these exceptions were not in the log.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.0.0
Release     : 0.0.960.20140430git0e798e42.el6

Topology:
\[UFS\]
\[UFS\]
\[CC SC\]
\[CC SC\]
\[CLC UFS WS\]
\[CLC UFS WS\]
\[NC\]


{code}
2014-05-01 12:48:48  INFO 000001845 Exceptions               | Failed to send message DeleteBucketType to service BukkitInternal because: Component that caused exception is: DefaultJavaComponent{BukkitInternal.component}. Message payload is of type: DeleteBucketType

fields.summary: Failed to send message DeleteBucketType to service BukkitInternal after HA failover

comments.body: This is not an HA issue, just an error response issue. Have a fix in a pending branch. Need to rebase on testing latest and merge it.

Internal commit: 1f33245c35f69d650f12a1fc1151e73abdd7fa1e
Eucalyptus commit: c7887cf1f8ed6a9f8c05575a2b709e69c3efcdc5

Fixes the exception handling that causes this error.

To test: HA walrus and failover, verify normal operation using regular s3 suite

I am still seeing exception but it is logged more cleanly. There does not seem to be a functional issue. Was the fix to not hit the issue or to log it better? Also, they are not continually logged anymore just once at the time of occurrence.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.0.0
Release     : 0.0.1045.20140520gitf07d4636.el6

To reproduce 
* ran the S3 suite in eutester4j
* invoked an HA failover of walrus
* Ran S3CopyObjects test and S3MultiPartUpload test in e4j

{code}
2014-05-22 15:57:11 DEBUG 000001501 WalrusProviderClient     | Error response from WalrusBackend
2014-05-22 15:57:11 DEBUG 000001501 ObjectReaperTask         | Object reaper execution task took 89ms to complete
2014-05-22 15:57:12 DEBUG 000001503 ropertySettingJobFactory | Producing instance of Job 'OsgJobs.job3', class=com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.jobs.MainBucketReaperJob
2014-05-22 15:57:12 DEBUG 000001503 QuartzSchedulerThread    | batch acquisition of 0 triggers
2014-05-22 15:57:12 DEBUG 000001500 JobRunShell              | Calling execute on job OsgJobs.job3
2014-05-22 15:57:13 DEBUG 000000065 Hosts                    | Hosts.entrySet(): 10.111.5.77 => Host 10.111.5.77 #208 /10.111.5.77 coordinator=10.111.1.16 booted nodb started=1400623696844 [/10.107.105.77, /10.111.5.77]
2014-05-22 15:57:13 DEBUG 000000065 Hosts                    | Hosts.entrySet(): 10.111.5.77 finished.
2014-05-22 15:57:13  INFO 000001500 Exceptions               | Failed to send message DeleteBucketType to service BukkitInternal because: Component that caused exception is: DefaultJavaComponent{BukkitInternal.component}. Message payload is of type: DeleteBucketType
2014-05-22 15:57:13 DEBUG 000000068 Hosts                    | Hosts.entrySet(): 10.111.5.77 => Host 10.111.5.77 #208 /10.111.5.77 coordinator=10.111.1.16 booted nodb started=1400623696844 [/10.107.105.77, /10.111.5.77]
2014-05-22 15:57:13 DEBUG 000000068 Hosts                    | Hosts.entrySet(): 10.111.5.77 finished.
{code}

[~zhill] and [~swathi], can you comment on [my last comment|https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-9281?focusedCommentId=71113&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-71113]? Is that the correct/desired behavior of the fix for this issue?

[~tony], repetitive delete operations and Walrus->OSG exception handling issue was fixed in EUCA-9397. What you are seeing is the right behavior, you'll see one log message anytime Walrus tries to delete a resource that does not exist
Thank you [~swathi]. That's all I needed. (y)

Fix Verified.

Error message is handled nicely, only shown once when issue arrives. Tested and verified per [my previous comment|https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-9281?focusedCommentId=71113&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-71113]
